reviewText: A little unfair for me to review... I worked on this film, UPM.  This is NOT your daddy's western.  Have an open mind and accept this quirky movie as a look at what a drug cartel might have been like in the 1800s.  (Filmed in historical cabins now located in Fernland Historical Park, in Montgomery, TX.
Another non-anamorphic widescreen transfer in 2007!!. Haven't come across Inspired Pictures before and with such a lazy transfer I don't won't to see any more of their DVD releases.
I enjoyed it. It went from funny to tense to poignant. A friend recommend it. Hadn't heard of it, but found it on amazon. Worth a watch. Even watched it a second time already.

I have a large collection of DVD movies.  I threw this one away directly after my first viewing, not wishing it to fall into the hands of anyone who might waste their time as I had.  I can't even tell you what it was about, it was so not good to be remembered.
Loved it.  I just love Westerns and this was one of the best I've seen in a while.  Good acting and just loved the old fat guy.  Lots of blood and fighting...my 8 year old will love it!

This is a refreshing new western with an interesting twist at the end.
Holds your interest with the twists and turns.
